questions.question_text: What is your monthly household income after taxes?
Do you live in a home that that is yours? e.g. you own a house or apartment.
How much cash do you have in a checking account?
How many dependents do you have? e.g. people who rely on your income (children, spouses, parents or other relatives)
What is your (approximate) net worth without the value of your primary residence, should you own it?

answers_to_show.answer_text: Secondary School or, in the U.S., High School diploma

questions.question_text: What is your highest finished education?
Which description best fits your job type?

Questionnaires.description: Questionnaire to assess the user's experience with the financial markets

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

questions.question_text: Do or did you work as a stock exchange broker, daytrader, investment analyst or similar?

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

questions.question_text: Do you work a knowledge-intensive, continuous learning job? (researcher, engineer, statistician, etc.)

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

questions.question_text: Do you trade individual stocks?

yes, completed and working in a corresponding job

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

questions.question_text: Do you trade cryptocurrencies?

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

questions.question_text: Do you trade commodities like gold or crude oil??

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

questions.question_text: Do you trade other alternative investments? ?

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

questions.question_text: Do you trade futures, options or other derivatives?

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

questions.question_text: Do you have a life insurance that invests in the stock market?

answers_to_show.answer_text: yes, for more than five years

questions.question_text: Do you track your monthly expenses in written form?
How do you rate your previous investment experiences?
What is your employment type?

answers_to_show.answer_text: not at all, never did, never will
not yet, but would like to
no longer, had to stop with this kind of activity
occasionally, but not on a regular basis
regularly, as a profession or primary occupation

questions.question_text: Do you engage in any risk-intensive physical activities (skydiving, motorcycling, other extreme sports)
Would you describe your self as risk-seeking?
Have you ever engaged in gambling? (online casino Games, Poker, sports bets, etc.)

Questionnaires.description: This questionnaire tests people on their ability to resist common cognitive biases

questions.question_text: How many people do think consistently earn money from daytrading?
Which of these would you prefer

answers_to_show.answer_text: Buy the stock now as it's cheap
Buy the stock when it regained half of the lost 30%
Don't buy the stock at all as it, apparently, was overvalued
Don't buy the stock now to wait until it further drops

questions.question_text: Assume a stock loses 30% of its value over two weeks. You do not own the stock.nWhich idea do you prefer?

answers_to_show.answer_text: Buy mroe of the stock now as it will probably rise further
Sell the stock to materialize your gains
Check tax considerations, then sell if appropriate
Research to find out why this raise occurred

questions.question_text: Assume a stock gained 10% over the last two weeks. You own the stock.nWhich idea do you prefer?

answers_to_show.answer_text: None, I always prefer the riskless investment

questions.question_text: Assume you could do a risk-free investment with 3% yield p.a.. Which risky investment would younprefer over the risk-free one?
What do you see in a stock market crash?
How many hours per week do you work (paid or unpaid)
What is your work schedule?
How much time do you spend per week on non-work, but obligatory things (e.g. care work)

questions.question_text: Do you engage in any risk-intensive physical activities (skydiving, motorcycling, other extreme sports)
Would you describe your self as risk-seeking?

Questionnaires.description: This questionnaire tests people on their ability to resist common cognitive biases

questions.question_text: How many people do think consistently earn money from daytrading?
Which of these would you prefer

answers_to_show.answer_text: Buy the stock now as it's cheap
Buy the stock when it regained half of the lost 30%
Don't buy the stock at all as it, apparently, was overvalued
Don't buy the stock now to wait until it further drops

questions.question_text: Assume a stock loses 30% of its value over two weeks. You do not own the stock.nWhich idea do you prefer?

answers_to_show.answer_text: Buy mroe of the stock now as it will probably rise further
Sell the stock to materialize your gains
Check tax considerations, then sell if appropriate
Research to find out why this raise occurred

questions.question_text: Assume a stock gained 10% over the last two weeks. You own the stock.nWhich idea do you prefer?

answers_to_show.answer_text: None, I always prefer the riskless investment

questions.question_text: Assume you could do a risk-free investment with 3% yield p.a.. Which risky investment would younprefer over the risk-free one?
What do you see in a stock market crash?
